Shirdi Sai Vittala Shesha Sai Vittala
Sri Ranga Vittala Rakumayi Vittala
Jaya Jaya Vittala Jaya Sai Vittala
Hey Ranga Vittala Panduranga Vittala
Meaning: This Bhajan extols the Glory and attributes of Lord Panduranga Vittala (Another name for Lord Krishna) of Pandharpur. He is none other than the Shirdi Sai who as Vishnu was reclining on the celestial Serpent Adi Sesha. Lord Vittala is the Consort of Rakumayi.
Songglossary: hey, jay, pandu, rakumayi, ranga, sai, shesha, shirdi, sri, vittala

Title: Shirdi Sai we remember You
Lyrics:
Shirdi Sai we remember You
 Our Loving thoughts are ever with You
 How we love You!
 Sathya Sai We adore You
 We speak our words before You
 How we love You!
 Prema Sai we expect You
 By our deeds we'll respect You
 How we'll love You!
 Trinity within us
 Creator, preserver, destroyer of us
 How we love all three!

Title: Shirdiyil Vazhnda Baba
Lyrics:
Shirdiyil Vazhnda Baba Puttaparthiyil Piranda Baba
Prashanti Nilaya Baba Trayee Brindavana Baba
Shivashakti Vadivame Baba Brahma Sattiyame Ni Baba
Kaliyuga Deivame Va Va Ennai Kattarulvai Ni Baba (2)
Meaning: Baba, who lived in Shirdi, born now in Parthi as incarnation of Shiva and Shakti, is the embodiment of Truth. Please grace us, O Lord of Kali age.
Songglossary: baba, brahma, brinda, deivam, emmai, kali, kattarulvai, ni, nilaya, piranda, prasanthi, puttaparthi, sathya, shirdi, shiva, trayee, uruvai, va, vazh

Title: Shiva Baila Shiva Toca Tu Tambor,
Lyrics:
Shiva Baila Shiva Toca Tu Tambor,
   La Danza Csmica Baila Seor
Tandava Tu Danza Toca Tu Tambor
   Para Que El Universo Gire En Torno De Tu Son
Eres El Espacio, Tiempo Y Universo, 
   Vida Y Trascendencia Baila Mi Seor
Meaning:
Lord Shiva, dance and play your drum, the cosmic dance, dance Oh Lord.
Tandava your dance, come and play your drum so the Universe can spin at
the rhythm of your beat. You are the space, time and Universe, Life and
transcendence Dance my Lord.

Title: Shiva Charana Ati Taruna Nith
Lyrics:
Shiva Charana Ati Taruna Nith Nith Bhajey Hum
Nith Nith Bhajey Hum Guru Charanam Vande [ Shiva Charana ]
Shiva Charana Ati Taruna Guru Charana Sharanam
Sathya Charanam Sai Charanam Sathya Sai Charanam
Sathya Sai Charanam Nith Nith Bhajey Hum
Meaning: We offer our Salutations at the divine feet of Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva. We offer our obeisance at HIS feet by singing HIS Glory incessantly.
Songglossary: ati, bhaja, charan, guru, hum, nithya, sai, sathya, sharan, shiva, taruna, vande

Title: Shiva great God almighty
Lyrics:
Shiva great God almighty, Shiva great God
 almighty, Shiva great God almighty, our Sai
 Shiva we sing to praise You, Lord of the mountain,
 Shiva, now in the form of Sai
 Destroyer of evil, great God Shiva
 Lord of all living beings, great God Shiva
 Lord of man, Lord of souls, Lord of all beyond
 Shiva great God within, Shiva great God within,
 Shiva great God on high, our Sai
 Shiva we sing to praise You, Lord of the
 mountain, now in the form of Sai
 Destroyer of illusion, almighty Shiva
 Lord of man, Lord of worlds, Lord of all beyond

Title: Shiva Hara Hey Hara Shiva
Lyrics:
Shiva Hara Hey Hara Shiva Hey
Samba Sadashiva Shiva Hara Hey
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
Parvathi Ramana Sadashiva
Namami Shankara Tava Charanam
Bhajami Shankara Tava Charanam
Meaning: We offer our obeisance at the feet of Lord Shiva who is worshipped as Sadashiva, Mahadeva and as the consort of Mother Parvathi.
Songglossary: bhaja, chara, hara, hey, mahadev, namam, parvathi, ramana, sadashiva, samba, shankara, shiva, tava

Title: Shiva Kumarane Shakti Balane Va
Lyrics:
Shiva Kumarane Shakti Balane Va Va Va
Sharavanabhava Guha Shanmuga Vela Va Va Va
Omkara Tattuvame Ni Va Va Va
Parthipurisha Sayi Naada Va Va Va
Kanda Va Va Va
Vela Va Va Va
Sayi Va Va Va
Meaning: Grace us with Your presence, O Lord Shanmukha! Son of Shiva and Shakthi, You are the inner meaning of Omkara. Please come, O Lord Sai residing in Parthi.
Songglossary: bala, guha, kanda, kumara, naada, ni, om, partheeshwara, sai, shakthi, shanmukha, sharavana, shiva, tattuvame, va, vela

Title: Shiva Linga Mangalanga
Lyrics:
Shiva Linga Mangalanga
Sri Ganga Gowri Linga [ Shiva Linga ... ]
Mandara Mala Linga
Nandeeshwara Rama Linga
Sri Ganga Dhari Linga
Shivarathri Atma Linga
Meaning: Salutations and Glory to the most auspicious form of Lord Shiva, the Shiva Linga described in numerous ways depict Shiva by various adjectives.
Songglossary: atma, dhari, ganga, gowri, linga, mala, manda, mangal, nandeeshwara, ram, shiva, sri

Title: Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Maheshwara Shiva
Lyrics:
Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Maheshwara Sai Ram
Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Shankara Shiva Mahadeva Sai Ram
Kailasa Vasa Mahadeva
Jagadeeshwara Hara Mahadeva
Tribhuvana Pala Baba Sai Deva
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva Maheshwara, who resides in the holy mountains of Kailasa. We sing your glory Oh Sai Mahadeva who is the Lord and protector of all creatures in the three worlds. (According to Hindu mythology there are three worlds, Sky, Earth and Sub-terrain. )
Songglossary: baba, deva, hara, jagadeesha, kailasa, mahadev, maheshwara, pala, ram, sai, shankara, shiva, tribhuvan, vasa

Title: Shiva Nataraj Nataraj We Surrender
Lyrics:
Shiva Nataraj Nataraj We Surrender
Jai We Surrender
Shiva Nataraj Nataraj We Surrender
Jai We Surrender
Come Lift The Veil Lift The Veil Of Illusion
Light Up Our Heart And Dispel Our Confusion
Jai We Surrender
Shiva We Surrender To You
Songglossary: jai, nataraj, shiva

Title: Shiva Natha Raj donde estas?
Lyrics:
Shiva Natha Raj, Donde Estas?
En El Corazon De La Verdad [ Shiva Natha ... ]
Baila Al Ritmo Del Tambor,
Ven Conmigo, Oh Senor.
Meaning: Dancing Shiva, where are you? You are in the truth of truth. Dance to the rhythm of the drum; come with me, O my Lord.
Songglossary: natha, raja, shiva, tambor

Title: Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva
Lyrics:
Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva Om
Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva Om Sai Om
Bhaktha Jana Priya Bhakthon Ke Pran Hai Sai Natha Shiva Om
Jai Jai Jai Shiva Om
Shanthi Pradayaka Prema Pradayaka Sai Natha Shiva Om [ Jai Jai ]
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva who is the embodiment of Primordial Sound, "Om" and who is the protector of His Devotees, who bestows peace and love among all beings.
Songglossary: bhaktha, bhakthon, hai, jai, jana, ke, natha, om, pradayaka, pran, prem, priya, sai, shanthi, shiva

Title: Shiva Priya Nandana Bhava Bhaya
Lyrics:
Shiva Priya Nandana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Gowri Priya Sutha Om Shadanana [ Shiva Priya ... ]
Hey Mayurasana Smitha Vadana
Sindhura Vadana Shubha Charana
Shanmukha Natha Subrahmanya Deva
Meaning: We pray to Lord Shanmukha who is the son of Lord Shiva and the one who removes all fears of the materialistic world, the one who sits on a peacock throne and whose face is charming, the one whose face is of reddish-brown color and whose holy feet is worshipped by all.
Songglossary: bhanjana, bhava, bhaya, chara, deva, gowri, hey, mayur, nanda, natha, om, priya, shadanana, shanmukha, shiva, shubh, sindhu, smitha, subramanya, sutha, vadana

Title: Shiva Sai Shankara Gangadhara
Lyrics:
Shiva Sai Shankara Gangadhara
Parthishwara Sathya Saishwara [ Shiva Sai ... ]
Trishooladharadhi Shiva Shankara
Trinetra Dhara Saishwara
Lingodhbhavakara Lingeshwara
Parthi Vihara Saishwara
Meaning: Lord Sai of Parthi is Lord Shiva with three eyes (the third eye is the eye of wisdom) who bears the Ganges and carries a trident. He manifests the Linga (on Shivaratri night).
Songglossary: dhara, ganga, lingeshwara, lingodbhava, partheeshwara, puttaparthi, sai, saiyeeshwara, sathya, shankara, shiva, trinetra, trishoola, vihar

Title: Shiva Sai Shankara Gangadhara (Hey)
Lyrics:
Shiva Sai Shankara Gangadhara (Hey)
Parthi Vihara Sayeeshwara [ Shiva Sai ... ]
Trishoola Dhari Hey Shiva Shankara
Deena Dayala Sayeeshwara
Lingodhbhavakara Lingeshwara [ Parthi Vihara ]
Meaning: This Bhajan extols the glory of Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva with attributes like, Gangadhara (the one who holds mighty Ganges in HIS matted locks), Trishoola Dhari (Armed with Trident) Deena Dayala (Compassionate to down trodden), Lingodhbhavakara (The one who manifests the sacred Lingam).
Songglossary: dayal, deen, dhari, ganga, hey, lingeshwara, lingodbhava, puttaparthi, sai, sayee, shankara, shiva, trishoola, vihar

Title: Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Shambho
Lyrics:
Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Shambho
Bhava Nasha Kailasa Nivasa [ Shiva Shambho ... ]
Parvathi Pathey Harey Pashupathey
Gangadhara Hara Gowri Pathey
Meaning: Oh Lord Shiva Shambho you are the destroyer of all fear, the one who resides in the holy mountains of Kailasa, the consort of Mother Parvathi, the One who holds the mighty Ganges in your matted Locks, The Consort of Mother Gowri - we pray and offer our humble salutations at Your Feet.
Songglossary: bhava, ganga, gowri, hara, hari, kailasa, nasha, nivasa, parvathi, pashu, pathey, shambho, shiva

Title: Shiva Shambho Narayana
Lyrics:
Shiva Shambho Narayana
Parthi Vasa Jagadeeshwara [ Shiva Shambho ... ]
Shirdi Vasa Jagadeeshwara
Sathya Sai Shiva Shankara
Meaning: We pray to our Lord Sai who is the embodiment of Lord Shiva and Lord Narayana who has come down to earth as the Lord of Parthi and Shirdi and the Lord of all the worlds. We surrender to you Oh Lord Sathya Sai Shiva Shankara.
Songglossary: jagadeesha, narayana, puttaparthi, sai, sathya, shambho, shankara, shirdi, shiva, vasa

Title: Shiva Shambho Shambho Shiva Shambho
Lyrics:
Shiva Shambho Shambho Shiva Shambho Mahadeva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva Shiva Shambho Mahadeva
Haalaahala Dhara Shambho Anatha Natha Shambho
Hari Om (Om Om) Hari Om Hari Om Namah Shivaya
Meaning: We sing the glory of Lord Shiva (Shambho Mahadeva), the one who has consumed the poison to save the world and the one who is compassionate and protects the needy and downtrodden. We pray to you Oh Lord Shiva and offer our salutations.
Songglossary: anath, dhara, haalaahala, hara, hari, mahadev, namah, natha, om, shambho, shiva

Title: Shiva Shankara Parvathi Ramana
Lyrics:
Shiva Shankara Parvathi Ramana
Gangadhara Bhuvanaabharana
Sharanagatha Vanditha Charana
Karunakara Bhava Bhaya Harana
Meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva Shankara who is the consort of Mother Parvathi, the one who holds the mighty Ganges in His Locks and whose radiance shines brilliantly over all worlds. We surrender and offer our prayers at Your Holy Feet Oh Lord who is most Compassionate and the one and who removes all fears.
Songglossary: bhava, bhaya, bhuvana, chara, ganga, harana, karuna, parvathi, ramana, shankara, sharan, shiva, vanditha

Title: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara
Shiva Shiva Shankara Samba Sadashiva
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om
Meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva who is  also known as Lord Shankara, Samba Sadashiva.
Songglossary: hara, namah, om, sadashiva, samba, shankara, shiva

Title: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Bhola
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Bhola Maheshwara Shambho Shankara
Ganga Jatadhara Gowri Manohara Shambho Shankara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Vyagrambaradhara Chandrakaladhara Shambho Shankara
Haalaahala Dhara Shaila Girishwara Shambho Shankara [ Ganga Jatadhara ]
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva who is also known by other names such as Hara, Bhola Maheshwara and Shambho Shankara. He supports the sacred river Ganga on His matted hair, He is the Consort of Gowri (Parvathi) and wears tiger skin, adorns the crescent shaped moon on His head and lives in mount Kailasa, the one who swallowed the poison to save Gods (during the conflict between the Gods and Demons. That is why Shiva is called haalaa-hala Dhara or Neelakanta - Blue throat).
Songglossary: bhola, chand, dhara, ganga, girisha, gowri, haalaahala, hara, jatadhara, maheshwara, manohar, shaila, shambho, shankara, shiva, vyagrambara

Title: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Shankara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Shankara
Trishoola Dhari Trinetra Dhari [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Chandrakaladhara Samba Shiva
Kailasa Vasa Gangadhari
Sayeeshwara Sarveshwara Hey Jagadeeshwara
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Sayeeshwara who is the embodiment of Lord Shiva, who is armed with Trident, has a third eye on His forehead, the Crescent moon on the head, who lives in Mount Kailasa, supports the sacred river Ganga on His head. He is the Lord of the Universe.
Songglossary: chand, dhari, ganga, hara, hey, jagadeesha, kailasa, samba, sarvesha, sayee, shankara, shiva, trinetra, trishoola, vasa

Title: Shiva Shiva Sai Shankara Roopa
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Sai Shankara Roopa
Shiva Parameshwara Samba Shiva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Bhola Shankara
Shirdi (Parthi) Pureeshwara Sai Shiva
Samba Shiva Sai Shiva (2)
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai Shankara who is the embodiment of Lord Shiva and worshipped by many as Lord Parameshwara, Samba Shiva, Bhola Shankara The One who took the form of the Lord of Shirdi is now with us as the Lord of Parthi.
Songglossary: bhola, hara, param, purishwara, puttaparthi, roopa, sai, samba, shankara, shirdi, shiva

Title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Hara Hara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Shambho Sai Shambho Shankara
Vyagrambaradhara Vibhuti Sundara Sai Shambho Shankara
Chandra Kaladhara Shankara Ganga Jatadhara Shankara
Tandava Priyakara Natana Manohara Haalaahala Dhara Shankara [ Vyagrambaradhara ]
Meaning: Sing the glory of Lord Shiva, the one who wears the tiger skin, smeared with ashes all over His body, with the crescent moon on His head and the Ganges flowing from His matted locks, the one who loves to do the Cosmic dance, the one who swallowed the deadly poison and held it inside his throat (during the conflict between the Gods and Demons. Shiva is also called Neela Kanta - Blue colored throat).
Songglossary: chand, dhara, ganga, haalaahala, hara, jatadhara, kaladhara, manohar, natana, priya, sai, shambho, shankara, shiva, sundara, tandava, vibhuti, vyagrambara

Title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Mahesha Girisha
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shambho Mahesha Girisha
Hara Hara Sai Mahadeva
Nandi Vahana Naga Bhooshana
Phaala Lochana Tripura Samhari
Parama Purusha Shiva Ganga Dhari
Chandrakaladhara Parvathi Ramana
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva, the consort of Parvathi. Salutations to the one who resides on Mount Kailasa, who moves around on Nandi, the celestial Bull, who wears the serpent as an ornament around His neck, has a third eye on the forehead, holds the sacred river Ganga and crescent moon on His head and who slayed the demon Tripura.
Songglossary: bhooshan, chandrakala, dhara, ganga, girisha, hara, lochana, mahadeva, mahesha, naga, nandi, parama, parvathi, phaala, purusha, ramana, sai, samhari, shambho, shiva, tripura, vahana

Title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Tandava Priyakara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shambho Tandava Priyakara
Bhava Bhava Bhairava Bhavani Shankara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Hara Hara Bham Bham Bhola Maheshwara
Dama Dama Damaru Natana Manohara
Sathyam Shivam Sai Sundara
Meaning: This Bhajan extols the attributes associated with Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva. He is described as the one who loves Cosmic dance (Tandava Priyakara), Simple in nature (Bhola) and personification of Truth (Sathyam), Giving (Shivam) and Beauty (Sundaram).
Songglossary: bhairava, bham, bhava, bhola, dama, damaru, hara, maheshwara, manohar, natana, priya, sai, sathya, shambho, shankara, shiva, sundara, tandava

Title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Hara Parameshwara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shankara Hara Parameshwara
Bala Gangadhara Sai
Shiva Shiva Shankara Parthi Pureeshwara
Nata Shiva Shankara Sai [ Bala Gangadhara ... ]
Meaning: Worship Shiva who is also known as Hara, Shankara, Gangadhara, Parameshwara and Nata Shiva Shankara (the one who performs Cosmic dance). He is also Lord of Parthi.
Songglossary: bala, ganga, hara, nata, param, purishwara, puttaparthi, sai, shankara, shiva

Title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Om Shiva
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shankara Om Shiva Om
Hara Hara Shankara Om Shiva Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Gowri Shankara Om Shiva Om
Uma Maheshwara Om Shiva Om
Shiva (Om) Shiva Shakthi Om Shiva Om
Neelakanta Sai Om Shiva Om
Meaning: Chant the name of Shiva who is accompanied by Divine mother Gowri (Parvathi) also known as Uma and Shakthi. Chant the name of Neelakanta (another name for Shiva as his throat looks blue after swallowing poison for the sake of Gods during their fight for nectar with demons)
Songglossary: gowri, hara, maheshwara, neela, om, sai, shakthi, shankara, shiva, uma

Title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Parthi Pureeshwara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shankara Parthi Pureeshwara
Vyagrambaradhara Sai Maheshwara
Haalaahala Dhara Hey Gangadhara
Natana Manohara Chandra Kaladhara
Samba Sadashiva Hara Parameshwara
Meaning: Lord Sai the resident of Parthi is none other than Lord Shankara, who wears the tiger skin as loin cloth, who swallowed the poison for saving Gods, holding sacred river Ganges in His matted hair, who is fond of dance and wears the crescent moon on the head.
Songglossary: chand, dhara, ganga, haalaahala, hara, hey, kaladhara, maheshwara, manohar, natana, param, purishwara, puttaparthi, sadashiva, sai, samba, shankara, shiva, vyagrambara

Title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Sayeeshwara
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shankara Sayeeshwara
Pranamami Pranamami Partheeshwara
Omkara Roopa Vishweshwara
Sayeeshwara Sarveshwara
Prema Swaroopa Partheeshwara [ Pranamami Pranamami ]
Meaning: Reverential salutations to Lord Sai of Parthi who is the primordial sound "OM" in human form. HE is worshipped by all in the Universe and HE is Love personified.
Songglossary: om, partheeshwara, pranamami, prem, roopa, sarvesha, sayee, shankara, shiva, swaroopa, vishweshwara

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om Hara Hara Hara Hara Om
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Hara Hara Sai Shankara Om
Sai Shankara Om (Sathya) (2)
Om Namah Shivaya Om Om Namah Shivaya Om
Dama Dama Dama Dama Damaru Bholey Bholey Shankara Om
Bholey Shankara Om (2) [ Om Namah ]
Meaning: Worship Lord Shiva who is a remover of all sins and cycle of birth and death, whose Damaru (The miniature drum Lord Shiva plays) chants "Om Shankara". He is today in the form of Lord Sai Shankara residing in Parthi.
Songglossary: bhole, dama, damaru, hara, namah, om, sai, sathya, shankara, shiva

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho Shiva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Sadashiva [ Shiva Shiva ]
Tandava Priyakara Shambho Sabesha
Parthi Mahesha Sai Shiva
Meaning: Chant the holy name of Shiva, Shambho and Sadashiva, Hara who is fond of celestial dance Tandava. He is also the Lord of Parthi, Sai Shiva.
Songglossary: hara, kanaka-sabesha, mahesha, priya, puttaparthi, sadashiva, sai, shambho, shiva, tandava

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shirdi
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shirdi Pureeshwara Shambho Shankara Sai Shivom
Bhava Hara Purahara Puttapartheeshwara Shambho Shankara Sada Shivom
Kailasachala Bala Shiva Kalakoota Hara Bala Shiva
Keli Lalasa Bala Shiva Leela Tandava Bala Shiva
Meaning: Oh! Lord of Shirdi, we worship you as Shiva, Parameshwara, Shambho, Shankara, Sai Shiva. You are the remover of fear and worldly misery, Your abode is Kailasa and you are a great dancer of Tandava (The celestial Dance)
Songglossary: bala, bhava, hara, kailasa, kalakoota, keli, lalasa, leela, purishwara, puttapartheeshwara, sada, sai, shambho, shankara, shirdi, shiva, tandava

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shankara
Gangadhara Hara Gowreeshwara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Chandrakaladhara Parameshwara
Haalaahala Dhara Hara Shankara
Yugadhara Phanidhara Shashi Shekara
Jatadhara Sai Bhaktha Shankara
Meaning: Worship Lord Shiva who is also called by many names such as, Shankara, Gangadhara (the one who supports the sacred river Ganga on HIS head), Hara, Gowri Shiva (Consort of Mother Gowri), Chandrakaladhara (having crescent moon on the head), haalaa-hala Dhara (The one who swallowed the poison to save Gods), Yugadhara (The one who upholds all eons), Jatadhara (The one with matted hair). Lord of Parthi is none other than the Lord Shiva who adorns the Serpent around His neck.
Songglossary: bhaktha, chand, dhara, ganga, gowrinath, haalaahala, hara, jatadhara, param, phani, sai, shankara, shashi, shekara, shiva, yugadhara

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om
Meaning: I prostrate before Lord Shiva destroyer of sins and evils. Chant mantra "Om Namah Shivaya"
Songglossary: hara, namah, om, shiva

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om [ Hara Hara ]
Meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, destroyer of Sins, cycle of birth and death.
Songglossary: hara, namah, om, shiva

Title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Alakh Niranjana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Sayeeshwaraya Namah Om
Pranava Swaroopa Parameshwara
Partheeshwaraya (Sathya Sayeeshwaraya) Namah Om
Meaning: Worship Lord Shiva with mantra "Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om". Pray to Lord Shiva who is ever pure, who dispels the fear of this materialistic world, who is the personification of the Primordial "Om". He is none other than the Lord of Parthi.
Songglossary: alakh, bhanjana, bhava, bhaya, hara, namah, niranjan, om, paramesha, partheeshwara, pranava, sathya, sayee, shiva, swaroopa

Title: Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Bhava Bhava Bhavaya Namah Om
Shirdi (Parthi) Pureeshwara Shambho Shankara
Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Parthi Shivaya Namah Om
Samba Shivaya Namah Om
Parthi Pureeshwara Shambho Shankara [ Hara Hara ]
Meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva who dispels the fear of the materialistic world, HE is none other than Shirdi Sai and Parthi Sai.
Songglossary: bhava, hara, namah, om, purishwara, puttaparthi, samba, shambho, shankara, shirdi, shiva

Title: Shiva, Shiva, hear us call
Lyrics:
Shiva, Shiva, hear us call
 We chant Your Name Lord Shiva
 We worship You Lord Shiva
 We bow to You Lord Shiva (Shiva)
 Who holds the Ganga in His hair (1X)
 Who holds the trident, twirling in the air (1X)
 Who plays the hand drum resounding everywhere
 Pounding, pounding, pounding sound
 Resounding everywhere
 Hear the whirling dance of Lord Shiva
 We bow to you Lord Shiva
 We sing to You Lord Shiva
 We worship You Lord Shiva
 We chant Your Name Lord Shiva

Title: Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
Lyrics: Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya (4)
Meaning: Worship Shiva and chant His name.
Songglossary: namah, om, shiva

Title: Shivaya Namah Shiva Lingaya Namah
Lyrics:
Shivaya Namah Shiva Lingaya Namah Om
Bhavaya Namah Bhava Lingaya Namah Om
Sarvaya Namah Sarva Lingaya Namah Om
Rudraya Namah Rudra Lingaya Namah Om
Atmaya Namah Atma Lingaya Namah Om
Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om
Meaning: Worship Shiva who is present in the form of sacred Lingam. He manifests Himself in different forms such as, the one who dispels the fear of the materialistic world, the one who is Omnipresent, the one who is our in dweller (higher self or Conscience).
Songglossary: atma, atmaya, bhava, linga, namah, om, rudra, sarva, shiva

Title: Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah
Lyrics:
Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Shiva
Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
Meaning: Chant the name "Shivaya Namah Shiva" every moment of your life.
Songglossary: namah, om, shiva

Title: Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandra Shekaraya Namah
Lyrics:
Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandra Shekaraya Namah Om
Haraya Haraya Haraya Namah Om
Shankaraya Namah Om
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
Bhavaya Bhavaya Bhavaya Namah Om
Guna Sambhavaya Namah Om
Meaning: Bowing to Lord Shiva, who is the Lord of the Universe with a crescent moon on His hair, and lover of the Tandava (cosmic) dance, gives us virtues to go through our cycle of birth and death.
Songglossary: bhava, chand, guna, hara, namah, om, param, sambhava, shankara, shekara, shiva, tandava

Title: Shivaya Parameshwaraya Shashi Shekaraya Namah
Lyrics:
Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandrashekaraya Namah Om
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandrashekaraya Namah Om [ Bhavaya Guna ... ]
Meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, the supreme one, who dispels the fear of the materialistic world, the one who adorns the crescent shaped moon on His head and performs the cosmic dance.
Songglossary: bhavaya, chandrashekaraya, guna, namah, om, paramesha, sambhavaya, shiva, tandavaya

Title: Shivaya Shiva Sai Deva Chandrashekaraya
Lyrics:
Shivaya Shiva Sai Deva Chandrashekaraya Namah Om
Bhavaya Partheeshwaraya Devadi Devaya Namah Om
Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om
Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om
Meaning: Chant name of Lord Sai, who is none other than Lord Shiva who dispels the fear of the materialistic world.
Songglossary: bhava, chand, deva, devadi, devaya, namah, om, partheeshwara, sai, shiva

Title: Shivaya Shiva Shiva Bhavaya Bhava
Lyrics:
Shivaya Shiva Shiva Bhavaya Bhava Bhava
Om Namah Shivaya Namah Shivaya
Shivaya Shiva Shiva Bhavaya Bhava Bhava
Om Namah Shivaya Namah Shivaya
Bhavaya Bhava Bhava Haraya Hara Hara [ Om Namah ]
Meaning: Chant the name of Shiva with the mantra "Om Namah Shivaya" which dispels one's worldly miseries.
Songglossary: bhava, hara, namah, om, shiva

Title: Shivoham Shivoham Shivoham Shiva
Lyrics:
Shivoham Shivoham Shivoham Shiva
Satchidananda Roopam Shivoham Shiva
Shivoham Shivoham Shivoham Shiva [ Satchidananda ]
Meaning: I am Shiva (Shivoham, which is a primary MANTRA of SHAIVISM, which means Shiva I am {Shiva-Aham }) the embodiment of Being (Sath), Awareness (Chith) and Bliss (Ananda).
Songglossary: roopa, satchidananda, shiva, shivoham

Title: Shravan Karo Manan Karo
Lyrics:
Shravan Karo Manan Karo
Sai Mahima Sai Mahima
Trikhand Nachey Sai Mahima Se (2) [ Shravan Karo ... ]
Yuga Avatari Leeladhari (2)
Parthi Pureeshwara Prabhu Giridhari
Narahari Roopa Sai Giridhari
Meaning: Listen and meditate on the glory of the Avatar of this Age, Lord Sai, residing in Parthi, who is none other than Lord Krishna in human form. The three worlds dance to HIS melody. (As per Indian Mythology the three worlds are Sky, Earth and the sub-terrain below the ocean).
Songglossary: avatar, giridhar, karo, leela, mahima, manan, nach, narahari, prabhu, purishwara, puttaparthi, roopa, sai, se, shravan, trikhand, yuga

Title: Shri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Sathya
Lyrics:
Shri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Sathya Sai Deva
Sadguru Sai Deva Jagat Guru Deva [ Shri Ganesha ... ]
Vighna Harana Dukha Harana Omkar Swaroopa
Shri Ganesha Deva Sathya Sai Deva
Mangala Kara Mangala Kara Shri Ganesha Deva
Meaning: Glory to Lord Ganesh, and Lord Sai, the true and Universal Guru. He removes obstacles and sorrows. He bestows good fortune and is the embodiment of the life-force (om)
Songglossary: deva, dukh, ganesha, guru, harana, jagat, jay, kara, mangal, om, sadguru, sai, sathya, sri, swaroopa, vighna

Title: Shri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru
Lyrics:
Shri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru Sai
Satchidananda Sada Sukha Dayi [ Shri Guru ... ]
Amrutha Varshini Anandadayi
Atma Nivasini Shri Sathya Sai
Meaning: Salutations to out true Guru, Sai, the personification of truth, knowledge and bliss. The indweller Mother Sai showers us with immortality and eternal bliss.
Songglossary: amrutha, anand, atma, dayi, guru, jai, nivasi, sada, sadguru, sai, satchidananda, sathya, sri, sukh, varshini

Title: Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai
Lyrics:
Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Guru Deva
Brahma Vishnu Shiva Guru Deva
Srishti Guru Sthithi Guru Laya Guru Deva
Siddha Guru Loka Guru Sathya Sai Deva
Meaning: Glory be to Lord Sai, the universal teacher. He grants liberation and is the cause of creation, preservation, and dissolution.
Songglossary: brahma, deva, guru, jay, laya, loka, sai, sathya, shiva, siddhi, sri, srishti, sthithi, vishnu

Title: Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai
Lyrics:
Shri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Sadguru
Nithyananda Brahmananda Prema Sai Sadguru [ Shri Guru ... ]
Gnanopadesha Gnana Sai Sadguru
Vedopadesha Veda Sai Sadguru
Gitopadesha Murali Sai Sadguru
Karuna Kataksha Sathya Sai Sadguru (He)
Meaning: Sai, the eternal teacher, is always full of love and bliss; He shows us the path of knowledge and gave us the Vedas and Gita. His glance is suffused with mercy and benevolence.
Songglossary: brahma, gitopadesha, gnana, gnanopadesha, guru, jay, karuna, kataksha, murali, nithya, prem, sadguru, sai, sathya, sri, veda, vedopadesha

Title: Shri Hari Sai Gurudeva
Lyrics:
Shri Hari Sai Gurudeva
Raghava Krishna Mahadeva [ Shri Hari ... ]
Deena Jano Ke Ho Tuma Taraka
Prema Sagara Patitodharaka
Sharana Me Leylo Gnana Pradayaka
Meaning: True Guru Lord Sai grants wisdom, and is an ocean of love. He is the star of hope to the weak. He is Rama, Krishna, Shiva, and Vishnu. Please, Sai grant me refuge.
Songglossary: deen, gnana, gurudev, hari, ho, jana, ke, krishna, ley, mahadev, patithodhara, pradayaka, prem, raghava, sagar, sai, sharan, sri, taraka, tum

Title: Shri Krishna Govinda Harey Murare
Lyrics:
Shri Krishna Govinda Harey Murarey
He Natha Narayana Vasudeva
Shri Krishna Govinda Harey Murarey [ He Natha ... ]
Meaning: Chant the names of Lord Krishna: Govinda, Murari, Narayana, and Vasudeva.
Songglossary: govinda, hari, krishna, murare, narayana, natha, sri, vasudeva

Title: Shri Purandara Sai Vittala
Lyrics:
Shri Purandara Sai Vittala
Shri Hari Madhava Govinda Vittala [ Shri Purandara ... ]
Pandari Natha Panduranga Vittala
Bhaktha Samrakshaka Shri Krishna Vittala
Parti Purandara Sai Ranga Vittala
Meaning: Chant the name of Vittala of Pandari (Lord Krishna). He is Lord Sai, the savior of His devotees and the resident of Puttaparthi.
Songglossary: bhaktha, govinda, hari, krishna, madhava, natha, pandari, panduranga, purandara, puttaparthi, ranga, sai, samraksha, sri, vittala

Title: Shri Rama Rama Raja Ram
Lyrics:
Shri Rama Rama Raja Ram
Jaya Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram
Shri Rama Ram Sita Ram [ Jaya Jaya ... ]
Shri Rama Ram Janaki Ram [ Jaya Jaya ... ]
Meaning: Glory be to Lord Rama, Lord of Janaki, and to Lord Sai.
Songglossary: janaki, jay, raja, ram, sai, sita, sri

Title: Shri Rama Rama Rama Ram
Lyrics:
Shri Rama Rama Rama Ram
Japte Manabhi Ram
Sitapati Ramachandra
Dasharatha Priya Nandananda
Hanumath Shri Charana Vanda
Puran Hota Manaki Kama [ Japte Manabhi ... ]
Meaning: Chanting in our minds the name of Lord Rama, consort of Sita and Dasaratha's favorite son, and at whose feet Hanuman served, will purify our desires and wishes.
Songglossary: chara, dasha, hanuman, hoga, japo, kama, mana, nanda, priya, puran, ram, ramachandra, siyavar, sri, vandana

Title: Shri Rama Sai Rama Jaya
Lyrics:
Shri Rama Sai Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
He Rama O Rama Omkara Rama
Parabrahma Param Dhama Prashanti Rama
Shirdeesha Partisha Sadguru Rama
Meaning: Lord Sai Ram of Shirdi and Parthi is the true guru. He is the embodiment of 'Om', and the inner peace.
Songglossary: dhama, jay, om, parabrahma, param, partheeshwara, prasanthi, ram, sadguru, sai, shirdeesha, sri

Title: Shri Sai Charanam Sathya Sai
Lyrics:
Shri Sai Charanam Sathya Sai Charanam
Prabhu Sai Charanam Namasthey Namasthey
Ramaya Charanam Krishnaya Charanam
Saishwaraya Namasthey Namasthey
Shri Guru Charanam Sadguru Charanam [ Prabhu Sai ... ]
Meaning: Salutation at the feet of Lord Rama, Krishna, Sai, the Lord of Parthi.
Songglossary: chara, guru, krishna, namostuthey, prabhu, ramaya, sadguru, sai, saiyeeshwara, sathya, sri

Title: Shringara Vela Shiva Shakthi Bala
Lyrics:
Shringara Vela Shiva Shakthi Bala
Devadi Deva Deena Dayala [ Shringara Vela ... ]
Kanda Kumara Kadirkama Vela
Karunya Sheela Shritha Paripala
Meaning: Chant name of Lord Subrahmanya, beautiful and compassionate son of Shiva and Shakthi, who is also called by the name Kanda and Kumara. He is none other than Lord Sathya Sayeesha who protects those who surrender to HIM.
Songglossary: bala, dayal, deen, deva, devadi, kadirkama, kanda, karuna, kumara, paripala, shakthi, sheela, shiva, shringa, shritha, vela

Title: Shrivatsankitha Sri Kaustubha Dhara
Lyrics:
Shrivatsankitha Sri Kaustubha Dhara
Madhava Mohana Krishna (2)
Sri Tulasi Dala Vanamala Dhara [ Madhava Mohana(2) ]
Kali Yuga Varada Kali Avatara
Karuna Sagara Sai (2)
Meaning: Bhagawan Sai the compassionate one is the incarnation of Lord Vishnu in Kali age, who is depicted to be bearing "Srivatsam" (The sign of Srivatsa. It is said to Symbolize Vishnu's yogic powers. )and "Kaustubham" (The splendorous jewel Kaustubham represents the consciousness of all living things. ). He is none other than Lord Krishna wearing the garland of Sacred Tulasi leaves (Basil Leaves).
Songglossary: avatar, dala, dhara, kali, karuna, kaustubha, krishna, madhava, mohan, sagar, sai, shrivatsankitha, sri, tulasi, vanamala, varada, yuga

Title: Shubha Janama Din
Lyrics:
Shubha Janama Din Shubha Janama Din
Shri Sathya Sai Bhagawan
Tava Madhura Nama Ananda Gana
Shri Sathya Sai Bhagawan (2)
Happy Birthday To You (2)
Happy Birthday Dear Swami
Happy Birthday To You
Meaning: This is an auspicious day as it is the Birthday of Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba. Sai, thy name is melodious to sing, Happy Birthday to you.
Songglossary: anand, bhagawan, din, gana, janam, madhu, naam, sai, sathya, shubh, sri, swami, tava

Title: Shuklambara Dhara Ganapathi Mantram
Lyrics:
Shuklambara Dhara Ganapathi Mantram
Nithyam Nithyam Japo Japo
Vighna Vinashaka Vidya Dayaka
Veera Ganapathi Bhajo Bhajo
Meaning: Chant daily the Mantra of Ganapathi, one who wears white cloth, who is the remover of all obstacles, the bestower of knowledge and one who is very courageous.
Songglossary: bhaja, dayaka, dhara, gananayaka, japo, mantra, nithya, shuklam, veera, vidya, vighna, vinasha

Title: Shyama Bhajo Bhajo Radhey Gopala
Lyrics:
Shyama Bhajo Bhajo Radhey Gopala
Shyama Manohara He Nandalala [ Shyama Bhajo ... ]
Murali Manohara Gopi Lola
Meera Ke Prabhu Giridhara Bala
Meaning: Worship Gopala, the Lord of Radha. Lord Krishna, the dark-complexioned son of Nanda plays the enchanting flute. He is the beloved of the Gopis, and the Lord of Meera. He held the mountain up to protect His devotees.
Songglossary: bala, bhaja, giridhar, gopal, gopi, ke, lola, manohar, meera, murali, nanda, prabhu, radha, sham

Title: Shyama Manohara He Giridhari
Lyrics:
Shyama Manohara He Giridhari
Radha Madhava Krishna Murari [ Shyama Manohara ... ]
Meera Ke Prabhu Natavara Lala
Narada Sangeeta Lola Gopala
Meaning: The dark-hued and beautiful Lord Krishna, who held the mountain up, is Lord of Radha. He is the Lord of Meera and destroyer of Mura. Sage Narada sang His glory.
Songglossary: giridhar, gopal, ke, krishna, lal, lola, madhava, manohar, meera, murare, narada, natavara, prabhu, radha, sangeeta, sham

Title: Shyama Murari Ayo Rey
Lyrics:
Shyama Murari Ayo Rey
Sai Murari Ayo Rey [ Shyama Murari ]
Gaayo Rey Gun Gaayo Rey
Payo Rey Peetambara Dhari
Meaning: Sing in ecstacy of the arrival of Lord Krishna who is none other than Lord Sai, also called Shyama Murari, wearing the yellow cloth characteristic of Lord Krishna's dress.
Songglossary: ayo, dhari, gao, guna, murare, payo, peetambara, sai, sham

Title: Shyama Shyama Radhey Radhey Radhey
Lyrics: Shyama Shyama Radhey Radhey Radhey Radhey Shyama Shyam (2)
Meaning: Chant Lord Shyam, Radhey Shyam.
Songglossary: radha, sham

Title: Shyama Sundara Hari Govinda Bolo
Lyrics:
Shyama Sundara Hari Govinda Bolo
Govinda Bolo Hari Gopala Bolo [ Shyama Sundara ... ]
Madana Mohana Prabhu Govinda Bolo
Kamala Nayana Prabhu Gopala Bolo
Radha Ramana Hari Govinda Bolo
Govinda Bolo Gopala Bolo (3)
Meaning: Chant the various names of Lord Krishna such as, Shyama Sundara Hari, Govinda, Madana Mohana Hari, Kamala Nayana Hari and Radha Ramana Hari.
Songglossary: bolo, gopal, govinda, hari, kamala, madana, mohan, nayan, prabhu, radha, ramana, sham, sundara

Title: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey
Lyrics:
Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey Gopal
Radhey Gopal Bhajo Radhey Gopal
Shankha Chakra Gadadhara Radhey Gopal
Jai Radhey Gopal [ Radhey Gopal ]
Murali Manohara Radhey Gopal
Jai Radhey Gopal [ Radhey Gopal ]
Meaning: Chant various names of Lord Krishna such as, Shyama Sundara, Madana Mohana, Shankha Chakra Gadadhara, Radhey Gopala, Murali Manohara etc.
Songglossary: bhaja, chakra, gadadhara, gopal, jai, madana, manohar, mohan, murali, radha, sham, shankha, sundara

Title: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey
Lyrics:
Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
Yadu Nandana Madhusudhana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
Nalina Nayana Narayana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
Deena Charana Dukha Harana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
Meaning: Chant the name of Govinda (Krishna) the beloved of Radha, from Yadu dynasty, the one with Lotus eyes, the one who gives succor to the downtrodden.
Songglossary: bolo, chara, deen, dukh, govinda, harana, madana, madhu, mohan, nalina, nanda, narayana, nayan, radha, sham, sundara, yadu

Title: Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari (2)
Lyrics:
Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari (2)
Shyamala Ghana Shyamala Megha Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari
Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari
Sridhara Yaduvara Krishna Murari (2)
Sridhara Nanda Yaduvara Bhava Bhaya Hara Giridhara Krishna Murari
Sridhara Yaduvara Krishna Murari
Meaning: Chant the name of the dark complexioned and soft natured Krishna, who is also known as, Murari, Ghana Shyama, Megha Shyama, Sridhara, Yaduvara, Giridhara etc.
Songglossary: bhava, bhaya, ghana, giridhar, hara, komala, krishna, megha, murare, nanda, sham, sridhara, yadu

Title: Siddhi Ranjana Duritha Bhanjana
Lyrics:
Siddhi Ranjana Duritha Bhanjana
Sri Sathya Sai Gajanana (Bolo)
Vighna Vinashaka Ashta Vinayaka
Sri Sathya Sai Shubhanana
Vakratunda Dhara Pranava Swaroopa
Sri Sathya Sai Shubhanana (Bolo)
Meaning: Oh Lord Sai, you are none other than the Lord Gajanana (Ganesha), who bestows auspiciousness, removes the obstacles in life and fulfills every wish. You are the personification of the Primordial sound "Om".
Songglossary: ashta, bhanjana, bolo, dhara, duritha, gajamukha, pranava, ranjana, sai, sathya, shubh, siddhi, sri, swaroopa, vakratunda, vighna, vinasha, vinayaka

Title: Siddhi Vinayaka Mangala Daata
Lyrics:
Siddhi Vinayaka Mangala Daata
Buddhi Pradayaka Gananatha [ Siddhi Vinayaka ... ]
Vighna Harana Prabhu Vighneshwara Tum
Gowri Nandana Hey Jaga Vandana
Namostuthey Namostuthey
Meaning: Oh Lord Vinayaka (Lord Ganesha) you fulfill our wishes and bestow auspiciousness. You bestow knowledge to all, Oh Lord of ganaas, you destroy the obstacles in our lives Oh son of Goddess Gowri (Parvathi), you are worshipped by the entire Universe. Salutations to you Oh Lord Vighneshwara.
Songglossary: buddhi, daata, gananatha, gowri, harana, hey, jagat, mangal, namostuthey, nanda, prabhu, pradayaka, siddhi, tum, vandana, vighna, vighnesha, vinayaka

Title: Siddhi Vinayaka Pahi Gajanana
Lyrics:
Siddhi Vinayaka Pahi Gajanana
Gowri Nandana Hey Jagavandana
[ Siddhi Vinayaka ... ]
Pashankusha Dhara Vighna Vinasha
Buddhi Pradayaka Paapa Vinasha
Meaning: Salutations to the elephant-faced son of Gowri, Lord Ganesha, bestower of auspiciousness and knowledge. He is the master of the universe who removes obstacles and destroys sins and who carries the noose and the hook.
Songglossary: buddhi, dhara, gajamukha, gowri, hey, jagavandana, nanda, paahi, paapa, pashankusha, pradayaka, siddhi, vighna, vinasha, vinayaka

Title: Siddhi Vinayaka Vidya Dayaka
Lyrics:
Siddhi Vinayaka Vidya Dayaka
Sri Gowri Sutha Vighna Nashaka
Shoka Vinashaka Duritha Nivaraka
Lambodhara Gajavadana Vinayaka
Sura Nara Sevitha Buddhi Pradayaka [ Sri Gowri ]
Meaning: Oh Lord Vinayaka you fulfill our wishes and you are the bestower of knowledge. Oh Son of Gowri (Parvathi) and remover of obstacles, you have mighty body worshipped by Gods and humans alike, you provide intellect to the seekers.
Songglossary: buddhi, dayaka, duritha, gajamukha, gowri, lambodhara, nara, nasha, nivaraka, pradayaka, sevita, shoka, siddhi, sri, sura, sutha, vidya, vighna, vinasha, vinayaka

Title: Sifuku no Umi yo
Lyrics:
Sifuku no Umi yo Fue wo Kanade
 Subete no Kokoro wo Toraeru Krishna
 Watashi no Kokoro wo Fue ni Tatoete
 Anata no Ai wo Kanadetamae
 
 Sung to the tune of Aanandha Sagara Muralidhara

Title: Silent Night, Holy Night
Lyrics:
Silent Night, Holy Night
All Is Calm, All Is Bright
Round Yon Virgin, Mother And Child
Holy Infant, Tender And Mild
Sleep In Heavenly Peace,
Sleep In Heavenly Peace.

Silent Night, Holy Night
Son Of God, Love's Pure Light
Radiant Beams From Thy Holy Face
With The Dawn Of Redeeming Grace,
Jesus, Lord At Thy Birth
Jesus, Lord At Thy Birth.

Silent Night, Holy Night
Shepherds Quake, At The Sight
Glories Stream From Heaven Above
Heavenly, Hosts Sing Hallelujah.
Christ The Savior Is Born,
Christ The Savior Is Born.
Songglossary: hallelujah

Title: Simha Vahini Sai Narayani
Lyrics:
Simha Vahini Sai Narayani
Mata Maheshwari Durga Bhavani [ Simha Vahini ... ]
Akhilandeshwari Jaya Jagat Janani
Abhaya Pradayini Ananda Roopini
Mangala Karini Moksha Pradayini
Meaning: Chant the name of Sai Narayani who rides on the Lion and who is known by many names as Mata Maheshwari, Durga Bhavani, Akhilandeshwari, Jagat Janani, Abhaya Pradayini, Ananda Roopini, Mangala Karini and Moksha Pradayini.
Songglossary: abhaya, akhila, anand, bhava, dayini, durga, jagat, janani, jay, kaarini, maheshwari, mangal, mata, moksha, narayani, sai, simha, swaroopa, vahini

Title: Simha Vahini Trishoolini
Lyrics:
Simha Vahini Trishoolini
Shritha Jana Palini Shiva Shankari [ Simha Vahini ]
Chidanandamayi Niramayi
Sadashivamayi Sayeeshwari
Meaning: Worship the Goddess Shiva Shankari, the one who protects all who surrender to her, the one rides on the Lion, carries the trident, one who is always full of bliss and happiness, one who is free from sorrow and fear, the consort of Sadashiva, the Goddess Sayeeshwari.
Songglossary: chidananda, jana, niramaya, palini, sadashiva, sayee, shankari, shiva, shritha, simha, trishoolini, vahini

Title: Simhasaneshwari Saishwari
Lyrics:
Simhasaneshwari Saishwari
Shiva Vama Bhage Sarveshwari [ Simhasaneshwari ... ]
Vande Vande Jagadishwari
Vande Vande Parameshwari
Meaning: Mother Parvathi sits on the throne on the left side of Lord Shiva. Pay obeisance to the Mother of the Universe, and to Mother Sai.
Songglossary: bhage, jagadeeshwari, param, saiyeeshwara, sarvesha, shiva, simha, vama, vande

Title: Sindhura Vadana Gajanana
Lyrics:
Sindhura Vadana Gajanana
Siddhi Vinayaka Sai Gajanana [ Sindhura Vadana ... ]
Parvathi Nandana Bala Gajanana
Mruthyunjaya Sutha Veera Gajanana
Jaya Jaya Jaya He Gowri Nandana (2)
Jaya Parthishwara Sai Gajanana
Meaning: Worship the elephant-faces Lord Gajanana, destroyer of obstacles and bestower of spiritual wisdom. Glory to the powerful and immortal son of Mother Parvathi (Gowri) and Lord Shiva. Glory to Lord Sai of Parthi.
Songglossary: bala, gajamukha, gowri, jay, mruthyu, nanda, partheeshwara, parvathi, sai, siddhi, sindhu, sutha, vadana, veera, vinayaka

Title: Sing His Name With Pure Love
Lyrics:
Sing His Name With Pure Love Sathya Sai
Feel Him In My Heart Oh Sathya Sai [ Sing His Name ... ]
Fill My Heart With His Love
See Through His Sight Of Love
Hear His Voice Of Love
(For) Love, Love, Love Is Sathya Sai
Songglossary: sai, sathya

Title: Sing out His praise
Lyrics:
Sing out His praise, sing out His praise,
 Praises to our Lord Sai,
 Sing out praises to our Lord Sai
 Lord of Puttaparthi, perfection and purity,
 Praise to God in human form
 Sing out His praise, sing out His praise,
 Praises to our Lord Sai,
 Sing out praises to our Lord Sai
 Light of all religions, You are everlasting,
 Here in answer to a human prayer,
 Heart's Delight of Your Mother Eashwarama,
 Praises to our Lord Sai,
 Sing out praises to our Lord Sai

Title: Sing with love in your heart
Lyrics:
Sing with love in your heart, sing to the Lord
 Feel His love from the start, sing to the Lord
 Sing to the Lord (3X), He's always with You
 Sing His Name, see His form, sing to the Lord
 Let Your Self be reborn, sing the Lord
 Sing to the Lord (3X), He's always with You
 If you like peace of mind, sing to the Lord
 Inner peace you will find, sing to the Lord
 Sing to the Lord (3X), He's always with You

Title: Sing, in this bright new day
Lyrics:
Sing, sing, sing, sing, in this bright new day
 Put on a smile, think constantly of Sai
 Love, love, love, love Him in all you see
 Yesterday's clouds make today's sun much stronger
 We've got the courage to serve all who need us
 We are the builders of Sai's new world together
 Respecting one another
 Loving one another

Title: Sita Mohana Sundara Rama
Lyrics:
Sita Mohana Sundara Rama
Sri Rama Jaya Rama
Raghukula Bhooshana Sri Raghu Rama
Ratnakara Kula Sri Sai Rama
Raghava Sundara Sri Raghu Rama
Ramya Manohara Sri Sai Rama
Meaning: Oh Sai Rama form the lineage of Ratnakara, you are Sri Rama from Raghu dynasty, consort of Mother Sita, you are the most beautiful and elegant Sai Rama.
Songglossary: bhooshan, jay, kula, manohar, mohan, raghava, raghu, ram, ramya, ratnakara, sai, sita, sri, sundara

Title: Sita Pathey Rama Jaya Shyamala
Lyrics:
Sita Pathey Rama Jaya Shyamala Komala Rama
Veda Gamanutha Vimala Charitha
Vathathmaja Priya Rama
Varija Netra Rama
Meaning: Salutations to you Oh Lord Rama, the consort of Mother Sita, with your dark complexion and soft nature you are the personification of the essence of Vedas, with your blemishless character and adored by Hanuman (Vathathmaja) you are most beautiful with Lotus shaped eyes.
Songglossary: charitha, gamanutha, jay, komala, nethra, pathey, priya, ram, sham, sita, varija, vathathmaja, veda, vimala

Title: Sita Pathey Sri Rama
Lyrics:
Sita Pathey Sri Rama
Dasharatha Rama Dayabhi Rama [ Sita Pathey ... ]
Rama Rama Jaya Rama Rama Jaya Rama ( Sai ) Rama Jaya Ram
Jai Jai Ram Sai Ram Sathya Sai Ram Ram
Raghava Sundara Rajeeva Lochana Paramananda Ram
Meaning: Victory to you Oh Lord Sri Rama who is the consort of Mother Sita, to the One who is the son of King Dasharatha and the most merciful One, the one with Lotus shaped eyes,, the most beautiful one from Raghu Dynasty and who bestows eternal bliss.
Songglossary: dasha, dayabhi, jai, jay, lochana, param, pathey, raghava, rajeeva, ram, sai, sathya, sita, sri, sundara

Title: Sita Rakshaka Rama Dootha
Lyrics:
Sita Rakshaka Rama Dootha
Lanka Dahana Ravana Mardhana
Sri Rama Dasa Daya Nidhey
Sarva Mangala Anjaneya
Meaning: Glory to You Lord Hanuman - who protected Mother Sita and who is the messenger of Lord Rama the One who put Lanka in flames and showed the path for Rama who killed Ravana the one who confers all auspiciousness on everyone, the one who is the son of Anjana, we offer our salutations to you Oh Lord Hanuman.
Songglossary: dahana, dasa, daya, doota, hanuman, lanka, mangal, mardana, nidhey, raksha, ram, ravana, sarva, sita, sri

Title: Sita Ram Bolo Bolo Sita
Lyrics:
Sita Ram Bolo Bolo Sita Ram Radhey Shyam Bolo Bolo Radhey Shyam
Hari Naam Bolo Bolo Hari Naam
Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram [ Sita Ram Bolo ... ]
Hari Naam Bolo Bolo Hari Naam
Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram
Hari Naam Bolo Bolo Hari Naam
Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram
Meaning: Sing the names of Lord Sita Rama and Lord Radhey Shyama, Lord Hari and Lord Sai.
Songglossary: bolo, hari, naam, radha, ram, sai, sham, sita

Title: Sita Ram Naama Bhajo
Lyrics:
Sita Ram Naama Bhajo
Madhura Madhura Sai Naama Bhajo
Radhey Shyam Naam Bhajo [ Madhura Madhura ... ]
Meaning: Sing the Name and Glory of Sita Rama, Radhey Shyam and Lord Sai whose names are the sweetest of all.
Songglossary: bhaja, madhu, naam, radha, ram, sai, sham, sita

Title: Sita Ram Sita Ram Sita
Lyrics:
Sita Ram Sita Ram Sita Ram Radhey Shyam Radhey Shyam Radhey Shyam
Dasharatha Nandana Janaki Jeevana
Raghukula Bhooshana Jaya Jaya Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram (Ram) Jaya Sai Ram
Meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, who is the crown jewel of Raghu Dynasty, who is the consort of Sita and the son of Dasharatha.
Songglossary: bhooshan, dasaratha, janaki, jay, jeevan, nandana, radha, raghukula, ram, sai, sham, sita

Title: Sita Rama Jaya Radhey Shyama
Lyrics:
Sita Rama Jaya Radhey Shyama Jaya
Mangala Charana Jaga Vandana (Shubha)
Sita Pathey Ramachandra
Raghava Raghu Nandana
Meaning: Salutations to you Rama from Raghu dynasty, you are the consort of Mother Sita, the whole world prostrates at your auspicious feet.
Songglossary: chara, jagat, jay, mangal, nanda, pathey, radha, raghava, raghu, ram, ramachandra, sham, shubh, sita, vandana

Title: Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Lyrics:
Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Dasharathey Hey Jaya Rama
Atma Rama Aganita Guna Dhama
Pavana Naama Parandhama
Meaning: Salutations to Rama from Raghu dynasty, who is the consort of Mother Sita, son of King Dasharatha, the one with blemishless character and whose name is sacred, HE is the supreme Lord.
Songglossary: aganita, atma, dasha, dhama, guna, hey, jay, naam, parandhama, pavan, raghu, ram, sita, sri

Title: Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Lyrics:
Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Ananda Roopa Hey Guna Dhama
Dasharatha Nandana Janaki Rama
Parthi Vihara Sri Sai Rama
Madhuvana Ramana Hey Ghana Shyama
Raasa Vilola Radhey Shyama
Meaning: Glory to the consort of Sita, Lord Rama, of Raghu dynasty, the embodiment of bliss, the abode of good qualities. the son of Dasharatha and the consort of Mother Janaki (Sita). Glory to the dark-hued Lord Krishna of Madhuvana, who danced with the Gopis and who is the Lord of Radha. Lord Sai of Parthi is verily Rama and Krishna.

Title: Siyabonga siyabonga wo Yesu
Lyrics:
Siyabonga siyabonga wo Yesu (4x)
 We say Thank you, thank you dear Jesus (. dear Swami) (4x)
 Onse danke danke vir Swami (4x)

Title: Smarana Karo Bhagawan Sai Ram
Lyrics:
Smarana Karo Bhagawan Sai Ram
Sai Ram Shubha Dayi Ram (2) [ Smarana Karo ... ]
Keertan Karo Tum Sai Ram
Sai Ram Shubha Dayi Ram
Meaning: Chant Lord Sai Ram's name . He bestows auspiciousness.
Songglossary: bhagawan, dayi, karo, keertan, ram, sai, shubh, smaran, tum

Title: Smitha Smitha Sundara Mukharavinda Nacho
Lyrics:
Smitha Smitha Sundara Mukharavinda Nacho Nandalala Nandalala
Nacho Nandalala Nandalala (3)
Meera Ke Prabhu Lala Nandalala (3)
Meaning: Dance in ecstasy, the remembering the gentle smiling lotus face of the darling son of Nanda, the Lord of Meera, Lord Krishna.
Songglossary: ke, lal, meera, mukha, nacho, nanda, prabhu, smitha, sundara

Title: So do Thou my Lord
Lyrics:
So do Thou my Lord:
 Thou and I, never apart.
 Wave of the sea, dissolve in the sea!
 I am the bubble, make me the sea.
 Make me the sea, O, make me the sea!
 I am the bubble, make me the sea.

Title: Soham Soham Dhyan Karo
Lyrics:
Soham Soham Dhyan Karo
Sadguru Sai Dhyan Karo [ Soham Soham ... ]
Soham Brahma Soham Vishnu
Soham Sai Dhyana Karo
Soham Atma Shiva Paramatma
Brahmananda Se Hrudaya Bharo
Meaning: Meditate on the divine word 'Soham' which means 'I am That'. Meditate on Sai who is our true and Divine Mentor. Soham is none other than Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva and the Atma (Higher self or Higher Conscience). Fill your hearts with Divine Bliss.
Songglossary: atma, bharo, brahma, dhyaan, hrudaya, karo, param, sadguru, sai, se, shiva, soham, vishnu

Title: Something beautiful is happening
Lyrics:
Something beautiful is happening to me, happening to me, happening to me
 Something beautiful is happening to me, since I found the light of the Lord
 Something beautiful is happening to me, happening to me, happening to me
 Something beautiful is happening to me, and I'm walking in His way

Title: Sora ni Ukanda Shiroi Kumo
Lyrics:
Sora ni Ukanda Shiroi Kumo
 Akai Yuuhi ni Somari Yuku
 Haha no Koromo no Iro ni Nite
 Namida Afurete Tomedo nashi
 Ware mo Hitorigo Kimi mo Mata
 Fukaki Mimune ni Idakaren
 Aa Sai Haha yo Mina Yobeba
 Kodama Yasashii Sai Rama
 Akai Yuuhi wo Abite Tatsu
 Ware wa Hikari no Ko to Naran
 Itoshiki Haha no Furusato e
 Omoi Todokeyo Kaze ni Nori

Title: Soul of all souls
Lyrics:
Soul of all souls, how can anyone fail,
 to surrender in Your Company
 I see You are the First
 The Origin of all creative causes
 The Master of all power
 The ultimate Domain of the realm of Nature
 The eternal Radiance
 The transcendental Self
 O, beloved Master, I bow down (3X)

Title: Spread Your light
Lyrics:
Spread Your light that all may see, O Sathya Sai Baba
 Some say You are Vishnu, some say You are Shiva
 You are my only love, O Kali Yuga Avathaar
 Spread Your joy that all may share, O Sathya Sai Baba
 Some say You were Rama, some say You were Krishna
 You are my only love, O Kali Yuga Avathaar
 Spread Your love that all may feel, O Sathya Sai Baba
 Some may call you Jesus, some may call You Allah
 You are my only love, O Kali Yuga Avathaar

Title: Sri Gananatha Devadi Deva
Lyrics:
Sri Gananatha Devadi Deva
Pranava Swaroopa Prabho Paahi
Pranava Swaroopa Prabho
Hey Shiva Nandana Bala Gajanana
Parvathi Tanaya Prabho Harey
Eshwari Tanaya Prabho Sai
Eshwari Tanaya Prabho
Meaning: I seek your succor Oh Lord Ganesha, the supreme one among Gods, the one who is the primordial form, son of Lord Shiva and Mother Parvathi, you are none other than Sai, the son of Eshwaramba.
Songglossary: bala, deva, devadi, eshwar, gajamukha, gananatha, hari, hey, nanda, paahi, parvathi, prabhu, pranava, sai, shiva, sri, swaroopa, tanaya

Title: Sri Gananatha Jaya Gananatha
Lyrics:
Sri Gananatha Jaya Gananatha
Sharanam Sharanam Gananatha (2) [ Sri Gananatha ]
Parvathi Nandana Bala Gajanana
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Gajanana
Pashupathey Priya Sri Ganesha [ Sharanam Sharanam ]
Meaning: I surrender to you Oh Lord Ganesha the leader of ganaas (attendants of Lord Shiva). Oh son of Parvathi and the dear son of Lord Shiva, you are none other than Sai Gajanana residing in Parthi. I surrender to you.
Songglossary: bala, gajamukha, gananatha, ganesha, jay, nanda, parvathi, pashu, priya, purishwara, puttaparthi, sai, sharan, sri

Title: Sri Ganapathi Hari Om
Lyrics:
Sri Ganapathi Hari Om
Ganapathi Hari Om Guna Nidhey Hari Om
Hari Om Hari Om
Varada Abhayakara Ananda Dayaka
Shiva Shakthi Nandana Om
Ganapathi Hari Om Guna Nidhey Hari Om [ Hari Om ... ]
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Ganapathi, the virtuous one, the one who destroys fears and bestows happiness, the son of Lord Shiva and Goddess Shakthi.
Songglossary: abhaya, anand, dayaka, gananayaka, guna, hari, nanda, nidhey, om, shakthi, shiva, sri, varada

Title: Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha
Lyrics:
Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha, Sadguru Deva Sai Ganesha
Parvathi Shankara Hey Paramesha
Rama Krishna Hari Govinda Vittala
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Shanmukha Natha Subrahmanyam (x3)
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai Natha Subrahmanyam
Meaning: Glory to Lord Ganesha son of Parvathi and Parameshwara. You are none other than the Lord Sai. Chant the names of Rama, Krishna, Hari, Govinda, Vittala, Subrahmanya and Lord Sai Natha.
Deity: Ganesha, Rama, Krishna, Vittala, Subramanya, Guru
GeneralComments: There are slight variations in the the lyrics of this song. E.g. Jai Guru instead of Sad Guru. Either version is correct, but it is recommended to follow one version to stay consistent.
Songglossary: deva, ganesha, govinda, hari, hey, jay, krishna, mahesha, natha, param, parvathi, ram, sadguru, sai, shankara, shanmukha, sri, subramanya, vittala

Title: Sri Ganesha Shivuni Kumara Shritha
Lyrics:
Sri Ganesha Shivuni Kumara Shritha Jana Vinuta Prabho
Sri Gananatha Sevitha Paada (3)
Naagati Neevani Nammiti Sada
Nagabharana Nanu Daya Ganavaa [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Iddari Tallula Muddu Kumara (3)
Bhakthuda Naiti Nee Vaddai Jerpara
Koddi Krupanu Naakosagi Brovara [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Koggu Gamana Naa Dikku Niveraa (3)
Makkuvuto Naa Madi Nilpitiraa
Akkara Seyaka Aadharincharaa [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Sajjana Sadhula Sannuta Charana (3)
Kujja Deva Gajaasura Harana
Bojja Vishala Vijaya Gajanana [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Sri Kailasapura Vighnesha (3)
Moravini Karunato Mammu Kaavamu Esha
Dvirada Vadana Shantha Prakasha [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Sri Sayeeshuni Sevaka Janulamu (3)
Sai Bhajanalu Cheyuta Manayamu
Jayam Idarava Raayamuna Deva Bhakthulu Kaavaa [ Sri Ganesha ... ]
Meaning:
Oh Ganesha! Son of Shiva, please listen to our prayers. Oh Ganesha! To you, we pay our obeisance. I have always believed that You are my ultimate goal, Oh Ganesha, ornamented by a serpent.
 
Please show your compassion on me. Oh sweet son of two mothers (Parvathi and Ganga)! We are your devotees. Take us across the shore; please shower a little grace on us. Oh Ganesha! You who walk slowly are our only recourse.
 
We sing your name with great adoration. Do not delay our Lord, come and bless us. Oh elephant faced one! You are worshipped by the upright and the seers.
 
Short in height, the slayer of Gaja demon, big bellied and always victorious. Oh destroyer of all obstacles! The resident of Kailasa, listen to our prayers with compassion.
 
Come and bless us, Oh Lord you have the body of two beings and is glowing with peace.
 
Oh Ganesha! We are the servants of Sai and we sing His Bhajans, have compassion on us and come quickly.
 
(Note - This is a very old Song /Bhajan sung in the Divine presence many years back and is in Telugu Language. Meanings are given in the best possible manner. )
Songglossary: aadharincharaa, akkara, bhaja, bhaktha, bhakthulu, bojja, brovara, chara, cheyuta, daya, deva, dikku, dvirada, esha, gajaasura, gajamukha, gamana, gananatha, ganesha, gao, harana, idarava, iddari, jana, janulamu, jay, jerpara, kaavaa, kailasa, karuna, koddi, koggu, krupa, kujja, kumara, madi, makkuvuto, mammu, manayamu, moravini, muddu, naa, naagat, naakosagi, nagabharana, naiti, nammiti, nanu, nee, neevani, nilpitiraa, niveraa, paada, prabhu, prakasha, raaya, sada, sadhu, sai, sajjan, sannuta, sayee, sevaka, sevita, seyaka, shantha, shivuni, shritha, sri, tallula, vadana, vadda, vighnesha, vijaya, vinuta, vishala

Title: Sri Ganesha Sri Ganesha Sri
Lyrics:
Sri Ganesha Sri Ganesha Sri Ganesha Paahi Maam
Jaya Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Raksha Maam
Sri Ganesha Paahi Maam Jaya Ganesha Raksha Maam
Jaya Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Raksha Maam
Meaning: Victory to thee Oh Lord Ganesha We pray to you to protect us.
Songglossary: ganesha, jay, maam, paahi, raksha, sri

Title: Sri Ganesha Vinayaka
Lyrics:
Sri Ganesha Vinayaka
Vighna Vinashaka Vinayaka
Mangala Dayaka Vinayaka
Bhava Bhaya Nasha Vinayaka
Parthi Pureeshwara Vinayaka
Meaning: Oh Lord Ganesha, remover of the fear of the materialistic world, you remove obstacles and grant auspiciousness, Oh Lord Vinayaka of Parthi.
Songglossary: bhava, bhaya, dayaka, ganesha, mangal, nasha, purishwara, puttaparthi, sri, vighna, vinasha, vinayaka

Title: Sri Gopala Gokula Bala
Lyrics:
Sri Gopala Gokula Bala
Tulasi Mala Sai Gopala [ Sri Gopala ... ]
Radha Vallabha Raasa Vilola [ Tulasi Mala ]
Meaning: Pray to Lord Sai Gopala of Gokula who is the beloved of Radha. He wears an ornament made from the beads of holy Tulasi plant.
Songglossary: bala, gokul, gopal, mala, raasa, radha, sai, sri, tulasi, vallabha, vilola

Title: Sri Guru Parthi Vasa
Lyrics:
Sri Guru Parthi Vasa
Sai Brahma Vishnu Mahesha [ Sri Guru ... ]
Allah Bhi Tum Ho Maulah Bhi Tum Ho
Zohrashtra Mahavira Yesu Bhi Tum Ho
Ram Rahim Ho Krishna Karim Ho
Meaning: Chant the name of Lord of Parthi who is Guru, Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesha, Allah, Zohrashtra, Mahavira and He is also none other than Rama, Krishna and Karim.
Songglossary: allah, bhi, brahma, guru, ho, karim, krishna, mahavir, mahesha, maulah, puttaparthi, rahim, ram, sai, sri, tum, vasa, vishnu, yesu, zohrashtra

Title: Sri Hari Bol Sri Hari
Lyrics:
Sri Hari Bol Sri Hari Bol Mukunda Madhava Hari Hari Bol
Ek Prabhu Ke Aneka Naam Prema Se Bolo Sai Bhagawan
Sai Bhagawan Bolo Sai Bhagawan
Meaning: Chant Hari's name who is also called, Mukunda and Madhava. There is one God, but He has many names. He is also known by the name Sai Baba. Chant Lord Sai's name with love.
Songglossary: anek, bhagawan, bol, bolo, ek, hari, ke, madhava, mukunda, naam, prabhu, prem, sai, se, sri

Title: Sri Hari Jaya Hari Nanda
Lyrics:
Sri Hari Jaya Hari Nanda Mukunda Hari
Radha Ramana Hari Narayana
Narayana Hari ( Sai ) Narayana
Meaning: Salutations to Sri Hari who is also Lord Narayana and beloved of Radha.
Songglossary: hari, jay, mukunda, nanda, narayana, radha, ramana, sai, sri

Title: Sri Hari Nanda Mukunda Harey
Lyrics:
Sri Hari Nanda Mukunda Harey
Dasharatha Nandana Rama Harey [ Sri Hari ]
Geeta Prabodhana Srivatsalanchana
Asurani Khanda Ravana Mardhana
Alakh Niranjan Rama Harey
Rama Harey Sita ( Sai ) Rama Harey
Raghupathi Raghava Rama Harey [ Dasharatha Nandana ]
Meaning: Chant the names Sri Hari (Krishna), Nanda's son, the name Rama, Dasaratha's son, in whose heart Sri Lakshmi resides. Oh Rama destroyer of many demons like Ravana, you are purity personified Oh Sai Rama.
Songglossary: alakh, asura, dasha, geeta, hari, mardana, mukunda, nanda, niranjan, prabodhana, raghava, raghu, ram, ravana, sai, sita, sri

Title: Sri Krishna Sri Rama
Lyrics:
Sri Krishna Sri Rama Sri Bhagavaan
 You show us the way of the Truth and the Light
 Sri Krishna Sri Rama Sri Bhagavaan
 Our hearts are made pure by Thy beautiful Sight
 You show us that God is within everyone
 Sri Krishna Sri Rama Sri Bhagavaan

Title: Sri Lakshmi Ramana Narayana
Lyrics:
Sri Lakshmi Ramana Narayana
Narayana Veda Parayana [ Sri Lakshmi ]
Bhava Bhaya Harana Vanditha Charana
Alakh Niranjana Narayana
Vaidehi Mohana Narayana (2)
Meaning: Salutation to Lord Narayana who is the beloved of Goddess Lakshmi, the one who has knowledge of all the Vedas, the one who removes the fear of the materialistic world and whose feet are worshipped by all, who is always pure and who has enchanted Vaidehi (Sita).
Songglossary: alakh, bhava, bhaya, chara, harana, lakshmi, mohan, narayana, niranjan, parayana, ramana, sri, vaidehi, vanditha, veda

Title: Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Giridhara Shyama
Lyrics:
Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Giridhara Shyama Murari
Bhaktha Vatsala Prabhu Hey Giridhari
Radha Ramana Sri Hari
Keshava Madhava Sadhu Samrakshaka
Sai Krishna Murari
Meaning: Oh Lord Krishna, you are adored by your devotees as well as your beloved Radha, you are saviour of the holy men and ascetics.
Songglossary: bhaktha, giridhar, hari, hey, kesha, krishna, madhava, madhu, murare, prabhu, radha, ramana, sadhu, sai, samraksha, sham, sri, vatsala

Title: Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Krishna
Lyrics:
Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Krishna
Devaki Vasudeva Krishna Krishna
Sri Jagannatha Krishna Krishna
Nanda Yashoda Krishna Krishna
Sri Sai Natha Krishna Krishna (2)
Meaning: Oh Madhusudhana, Krishna, son of Devaki and Vasudeva, the Lord of this Universe, you are also the charming lad of mother Yashoda and King Nanda, you are none other than Sai Krishna.
Songglossary: devaki, jagan, krishna, madhu, nanda, natha, sai, sri, vasudeva, yashoda

Title: Sri Mallikarjuna Maheshwara
Lyrics:
Sri Mallikarjuna Maheshwara
Sri Sai Shambho Vishweshwara [ Sri Mallikarjuna ... ]
Srisaila Vasa Sureshwara
Sri Bhramaramba Hrudayeshwara
Parvathi Ramana Parameshwara
Meaning: This Bhajan praises Lord Shiva, the presiding deity in Srisailam, in Andhra Pradesh State in India, who is the Consort of Parvathi, with various names, which are HIS attributes such as, Mallikarjuna, Vishweshwara, Sri Shaila Vasa, the one who resides in the heart of Bhramaramba (Parvathi's name in Srisailam)
Songglossary: bhramaramba, hrudayeshwara, maheshwara, mallikarjuna, param, parvathi, ramana, sai, shambho, sri, srisaila, suresham, vasa, vishweshwara

Title: Sri Mata Jaganmata
Lyrics:
Sri Mata Jaganmata
Sai Mata Shashi Gowri Mata
Dharani Mata Paripoorani Mata
Jagadharani Mata Bhava Haarini Mata
Meaning: Oh Mother Sai, the mother of universe, the mother of auspiciousness, the one who fulfills all our wishes and liberate us from this materialistic world, who is none other than the Mother Earth, our Salutations to you.
Songglossary: bhava, dhara, gowri, haarini, jagadharani, jagan, mata, paripoorani, sai, shashi, sri

Title: Sri Raghu Nandana Bhava Bhaya
Lyrics:
Sri Raghu Nandana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Sita Pathey Ramachandra (Hey)
Parama Pavitra Varija Netra
Jagadodhara Nirakara [ Sita Pathey ]
Ahalyodhara Sabari Raghuraya
Raghukula Bhooshana Rajeeva Lochana [ Sita Pathey ... ]
Meaning: Oh Sri Rama, you are the ornament of Raghu Dynasty, you are the destroyer of fear of this materialistic world. Oh Lord of mother Sita, your eyes are like Lotus, Oh Formless one, upholder of the universe, the one who liberated Ahalya from a curse, our Salutations to you.
Songglossary: ahalyodharaka, bhanjana, bhava, bhaya, bhooshan, hey, jagadodhara, lochana, nanda, nethra, nirakara, param, pathey, pavitra, raghu, rajeeva, ramachandra, sabari, sita, sri, varija

Title: Sri Raghu Nandana Dasharatha Nandana
Lyrics:
Sri Raghu Nandana Dasharatha Nandana
Bhadradeeshwara Rama
Vaidehi Priya Vaikunta Vasa
Sada Smarami Ramethi Rama
Meaning: Chant incessantly the holy name of Rama from Raghu Dynasty. He who is the son of King Dasharatha and who is the presiding deity in Bhadrachalam (A holy place), who is the beloved of Vaidehi (another name for Sita and who resides in Vaikunta (the abode of Lord Vishnu).
Songglossary: bhadradeeshwara, dasha, nanda, priya, raghu, ram, ramethi, sada, smaran, sri, vaidehi, vaikunta, vasa

Title: Sri Raghu Nandana Janaki Jeevana
Lyrics:
Sri Raghu Nandana Janaki Jeevana
Rama Rama Rama Sai (Ram)
Alakh Niranjana Asurani Khandana
Rajeeva Lochana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana [ Rama Rama ... ]
Meaning: Worship Lord Rama, who is the Consort of Janaki (Sita), who is always pure, the slayer of demons, one with eyes like Lotus and who destroys the fear of the materialistic world.
Songglossary: alakh, asura, bhanjana, bhava, bhaya, janaki, jeeva, khandana, lochana, nanda, niranjan, raghu, rajeeva, ram, sai, sri

Title: Sri Raghu Nandana Sita Rama
Lyrics:
Sri Raghu Nandana Sita Rama
Rajeeva Lochana Raja Rama
Raja ( Sai ) Rama
Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Pavana Naama
Atma Rama Sai Rama
Kalimala Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
Meaning: Worship Lord Rama of Raghu Dynasty, the consort of Sita, Sri Rama with Lotus eyes, the one whose sacred name destroys the fear of the materialistic world, the Sai Rama who is Atma Rama (Inner self or Higher Conscience) The Rama who wields the bow named "Kodanda" and who destroys the impurities of the age of Kali.
Songglossary: atma, bhanjana, bhava, bhaya, kalimala, kodanda, lochana, naam, nanda, pavan, raghu, raja, rajeeva, ram, sai, sita, sri

Title: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya
Lyrics:
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram (2)
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Sri Ram Jaya Ram Sathya Sai Ram
Meaning: Chant the glory of Lord Rama. Victory to Lord Sathya Sai Ram.
Songglossary: jay, ram, sai, sathya, sri

Title: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya
Lyrics:
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
Patitha Pavana Rama Harey Jaya Raghava Sundara Ram
Deenodharana Rama Harey Jaya Maruti Sevitha Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Raghu Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
Meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the embodiment of auspiciousness, the very life of Janaki (Sita) the up lifter of downtrodden, the beautiful one from Raghava Dynasty, who sanctifies the sinners and the one who is worshipped by Maruti (Hanuman).
Songglossary: deenodharana, hari, janaki, jay, jeeva, maruthi, patitha, pavan, raghava, raghu, ram, sevita, sri, sundara

Title: Sri Rama Charanam Smaramyaham
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Charanam Smaramyaham
Sthira Sukha Dayaka Sai Charanam [ Sri Rama ... ]
Shritha Jana Palaka Shirdi Charanam
Srikara Shubha Kara Parthi Charanam
Meaning: Worship the feet of Sri Rama, which bestows eternal bliss, the feet of Shirdi Sai, which bestows austerity to those who worship them and the feet of Parthi Sai, which bestows wealth and prosperity.
Songglossary: chara, dayaka, jana, kara, palaka, puttaparthi, ram, sai, shirdi, shritha, shubh, smaramyaham, sri, srikara, sthira, sukh

Title: Sri Rama Charanam Sri Rama
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Charanam Sri Rama Charanam Sri Rama Charanam Bhajey(2)
Vaidehi Ramam Vaikunta Dhaamam
Bhoopala Choodamani
Atmabhi Ramam Prabhu Sai Ramam
Sri (Sathya Sai) Rama Charanam Bhajey (3)
Meaning: Worship the feet of Lord Sri Rama, Lord of Vaidehi, whose abode is Vaikunta. Like the Choodamani, which is the best among the jewels worn on the head, Sri Rama is the Crown Jewel among the kings who have ruled this world. He is the Atma (Higher self or Higher conscience) Rama, Sathya Sai Rama.
Songglossary: atmabhi, bhaja, bhoopala, chara, chooda, dhaam, prabhu, ram, sai, sathya, sri, vaidehi, vaikunta

Title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Jaya Rama
Hey Bhaava Priya Sai Rama (2)
Sathya Priya Dharma Priya
Shanthi Priya Prema Priya
Prashanthi Priya Sai Rama [ Hey Bhaava Priya ]
Meaning: Victory to Sri Rama who responds to one's inner feelings. You are Sai Rama of Prashanthi Nilayam, the one who is fond of, righteousness, peace and divine love.
Songglossary: bhaav, dharma, hey, jay, prashanthi, prem, priya, ram, sai, sathya, shanthi, sri

Title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Jaya Rama
Dasharathey Jaya Raghu Rama
Kalyana Rama Kodanda Rama
Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Ram Jaya Ram (Sri)
Sri ( Sai ) Ram Ram Ram Jaya Ram Ram Ram
Meaning: Victory to the Lord Rama, son of Dasharatha, known by various names as Kalyana Rama, Kodanda Rama, Sita Rama and Raghu Rama.
Songglossary: dasha, jay, kalyan, kodanda, raghu, ram, sai, sita, sri

Title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Sundara Rama [ Sri Rama ... ]
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Mangala Naama
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Atma Rama
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Sai Rama (2)
Meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the most beautiful, the one whose name is auspicious, the one who is the in dweller, Atma Rama (Higher conscience or Higher Self)
Songglossary: atma, jay, mangal, naam, ram, sai, sri, sundara

Title: Sri Rama Naamam Ramaneeya Naamam
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Naamam Ramaneeya Naamam
Sundara Ramam Sugunabhi Ramam [ Sri Rama ... ]
Munijana Vanditha Mohana Ramam
Janaki Ramam Jagadabhi Ramam
Taraka Naamam Sathya Sai Naamam [ Sundara Rama ... ]
Meaning: Oh Lord Rama, your name is as enchanting as your form. You are beautiful and full of divine qualities worshipped by sages and pious people You are the Consort of Janaki and the Lord of Universe Sai Rama! Your name provides deliverance from sins. (Taraka Naamam)
Songglossary: jagadabhi, janaki, mohan, munijana, naam, ram, ramaneeya, sai, sathya, sri, suguna, sundara, taraka, vanditha

Title: Sri Rama Namostuthey Sai Krishna
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Namostuthey Sai Krishna Namostuthey
Shirdi Sai Namostuthey
Parthi Baba Namostuthey
Namostuthey Namostuthey
Sai Krishna Namostuthey
Meaning: We worship and chant Sri Rama and Sri Krishna who is also residing in Shirdi and Parthi.
Songglossary: baba, krishna, namostuthey, puttaparthi, ram, sai, shirdi, sri

Title: Sri Rama Raghu Nandana Ghana
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Raghu Nandana Ghana Shyama Yadu Nandana
Sri Ranga Nanda Nandana Sri Ranga Nanda Nandana
Ananda Nanda Gopi Ranjana Niranjana
Sri Rama Raghu Nandana
Ghana Shyama Yadu Nandana
Meaning: Chant the holy name of Sri Rama who is of Raghu dynasty. He is none other than Ghana Shyama, Yadu Nandana, Sri Ranga (All names of Vishnu and Krishna) bestowing bliss and the one who is adored by Gopikas.
Songglossary: anand, ghana, gopi, nanda, niranjan, raghu, ram, ranga, ranjana, sham, sri, yadu

Title: Sri Rama Rama Ram Yadu
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Rama Ram Yadu Nandana Hey Ghana Shyam
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram (3)
Raghupathi Raghava Raja Ram
Patitha Pavana Sita Ram [ Sri Ram Jaya(3) ]
Meaning: Sing the name of Rama, who is beloved of Sita and Son of Dasharatha and star of Raghu Clan. Fill the mind with the glory of Rama, who sanctifies the sinners. Repeat the name of Sai Ram.
Songglossary: ghana, hey, jay, nanda, patitha, pavan, raghava, raghu, raja, ram, sham, sita, sri, yadu

Title: Sri Rama Rama Rama Raghu
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Rama Rama Raghu Nandana Rama Ram
Sri Rama Rama Rama Bharatagraja Rama Ram
Sri Rama Rama Rama Ranadheera Rama Ram
Sri Rama Rama Rama Sharanam Tava Rama Ram
Meaning: I surrender to you Oh courageous Lord Rama of the Raghu Dynasty and the elder brother of Bharata.
Songglossary: bharata, nanda, raghu, ram, ranadheera, sharan, sri, tava

Title: Sri Rama Rama Rama Sita
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Rama Rama Sita Rama Raghava (2)
Narayana Hari Narayana (3)
Meaning: Chant the various names of Rama - Sita Rama, Raghava, Narayana.
Songglossary: hari, narayana, raghava, ram, sita, sri

Title: Sri Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Sri Rama Sita Rama [ Sri Rama ... ]
Sri Rama Megha Shyama
Sri Rama Sai Rama
Meaning: Chant the various names of Rama - Raghu Rama, Sita Rama, Megha Shyama, Sai Rama.
Songglossary: megha, raghu, ram, sai, sham, sita, sri

Title: Sri Rama Sundara Naama
Lyrics:
Sri Rama Sundara Naama
Raghu Rama Taraka Naama [ Sri Rama ]
Dasharatha Nandana Sri Rama
Dharma Samrakshaka Sugunabhi Rama
Kalimala Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
Karuna Sagara Kalyana Rama
Meaning: The name Rama is beautiful and provides deliverance from sins. Rama, the son of King Dasharatha has come to uphold righteousness, is noble. He gives succor to sins of the Kali age, is ocean of compassion and auspiciousness.
Songglossary: bhanjana, dasha, dharma, kalimala, kalyan, karuna, kodanda, naam, nanda, raghu, ram, sagar, samraksha, sri, suguna, sundara, taraka

Title: Sri Ramachandra Jaya Jagannatha
Lyrics:
Sri Ramachandra Jaya Jagannatha
Sita Pathey Jaya Raghu Natha
Patitha Pavana Deena Natha
Deena Natha Deena Natha [ Patitha Pavana ]
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Natha [ Sita Pathey ]
Meaning: Worship Lord Rama, who is the Lord of the whole world and of the Raghu Dynasty, the consort of Sita, the one who sanctifies the sinners and who is the Lord of Parthi - Sai Natha.
Songglossary: deen, jagan, jay, natha, pathey, patitha, pavan, purishwara, puttaparthi, raghu, ramachandra, sai, sita, sri

Title: Sri Ramachandra Jaya Ramachandra
Lyrics:
Sri Ramachandra Jaya Ramachandra
Raghuveera Ranadheera Raghukula Rama [ Sri Ramachandra ... ]
Dasharatha Nandana Dayabhi Rama
Danava Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
Kalyana Rama Kamaneeya Rama [ Raghuveera ]
Meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the valiant hero of the battlefield, the son of Dasharatha, the compassionate one, the slayer of demons, the wielder of the sacred bow Kodanda, one who does good to everyone and who is very attractive to look at.
Songglossary: bhanjana, danava, dasha, dayabhi, jay, kalyan, kamaneeya, kodanda, nanda, raghu, ram, ramachandra, ranadheera, sri

Title: Sri Ranga Harey Vittala Sai
Lyrics:
Sri Ranga Harey Vittala Sai Ranga Harey Vittala
Hey Daya Nidhey Vittala Hey Krupa Nidhey Vittala
Hey Sai Prabho Vittala Sathya Sai Prabho Vittala
Meaning: Chant Sri Ranga, Vittala who is all compassionate and merciful Oh Lord Sai Vittala, Oh Sathya Sai Vittala.
Songglossary: daya, hari, hey, krupa, nidhey, prabhu, ranga, sai, sathya, sri, vittala

Title: Sri Ranga Sai Shesha Sai
Lyrics:
Sri Ranga Sai Shesha Sai
Sevitha Mohana Sri Sathya Sai [ Sri Ranga ... ]
Karunalaya Sri Ranga Sai
Kamaneeyanana Sri Sathya Sai [ Sri Ranga ... ]
Jaya Jaya Govinda Govardhana Sai
Jaya Jaya Gopala Vanditha Sai
Meaning: Sri Ranga is all charming and Lord Sai is resting on serpent "Sesha". He is all compassionate and worshipped in different forms as Sri Ranga, Govinda, holder of Govardhana mountain, Mother Sai and Gopala. He is all attractive, charming Lord Sai.
Songglossary: gopal, govardhan, govinda, jay, kamaneeya, karuna, mohan, ranga, sai, sathya, sevita, shesha, sri, vanditha

Title: Sri Ranga Sri Ranga Ranga
Lyrics:
Sri Ranga Sri Ranga Ranga Ranga Sri Ranga (2)
Kaveri Thata Vasa Kasturi Ranga
Karunya Lavanya Karunanta Ranga
Jaya Panduranga Jaya Sai Ranga (2)
Meaning: Chant the name of Lord Sriranga who resides on the banks of river Kaveri. He is compassionate and His beauty is enchanting. Victory to you Oh Lord Panduranga.
Songglossary: jay, karuna, kasturi, kaveri, lavanya, pandu, ranga, sai, sri, thata, vasa

Title: Sri Ranga Vittala Pandari Natha
Lyrics:
Sri Ranga Vittala Pandari Natha Vittala ( Jaya )
Sri Ranga Panduranga Sai Ranga Vittala [ Sri Ranga Vittala ]
Rakumayi Vittala Radhey Shyam Vittala
Dwarakamayi Vittala Purandara Vittala [ Sri Ranga Panduranga ]
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Vittala of Pandari the consort of Rakumayi and the beloved of Radha. He is also the Dwarakamayi (Shirdi Sai).
Songglossary: dwaraka, jay, natha, pandari, pandu, puran, radha, rakumayi, ranga, sai, sham, sri, vittala

Title: Sri Ranga Vittala Vittala Narayana
Lyrics:
Sri Ranga Vittala Vittala Narayana
Panduranga Vittala Vittala Narayana
Rakumayi Vittala Vittala Narayana
Dwarakamayi Vittala Vittala Narayana
Sri Sai Vittala Vittala Narayana
Meaning: Pray to Sai Vittala who is none other than Narayana, Panduranga the beloved of Rakumayi and resident of Dwarakamayi (Shirdi Sai).
Songglossary: dwaraka, narayana, pandu, rakumayi, ranga, sai, sri, vittala

Title: Sri Rangana Krishnana Devaki Nandana
Lyrics:
Sri Rangana Krishnana Devaki Nandana
Kamala Nayana Shyamala Vadana Ananda Chandana [ Sri Rangana ... ]
Venu Vilolana Gopika Ranjana Yashoda Nandana
Ananda Chandana
Yashoda Nandana
Meaning: Oh Lord Ranganatha, Krishna, son of Devaki, with your Lotus eyes, body of dark complexion, with the flute in your hand your are happiness personified, Oh son of Yashoda.
Songglossary: anand, chand, devaki, gopi, kamala, krishna, nanda, nayan, ranga, ranjana, sham, sri, vadana, venu, vilola, yashoda

Title: Sri Sai Gananayakam Ganapathim
Lyrics:
Sri Sai Gananayakam Ganapathim
Bhaktha Jana Vanditham Pavanam [ Sri Sai ... ]
Vidya Buddhi Pradayaka Devam
Bhava Bhaya Haranam Bhavani Tanayam
Meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai Ganapathi who is the Lord of ganaas (Attendants of Lord Shiva) He is worshipped by his devotees who are sanctified by His grace Oh! Son of Bhavani, you are the provider of knowledge, education and the one who dispels fear of sins and cycle of birth and death.
Songglossary: bhaktha, bhava, bhaya, buddhi, devam, gananayaka, harana, jana, pavan, pradayaka, sai, sri, tanaya, vanditha, vidya

Title: Sri Sai Natha Deena Natha
Lyrics:
Sri Sai Natha Deena Natha
Parthi Puri Bhagawan
Shantha Swaroopa Premavatara
Karuna Swaroopa Bhagawan
Rajeeva Lochana Ananda Rama
Mangala Nayanabhi Ram
Meaning: Salutations to the Lord of Parthi, the compassionate Lord of the needy and downtrodden, the personification of Peace, Mercy, the one with Lotus eyes, which bestow auspiciousness.
Songglossary: anand, bhagawan, deen, karuna, lochana, mangal, natha, nayan, premavatara, puri, puttaparthi, rajeeva, ram, sai, shantha, sri, swaroopa

Title: Sri Sai Natha Guru Govinda
Lyrics:
Sri Sai Natha Guru Govinda
Parthi Pureeshwara Jaya Govinda
Prashanthi Nilaya Radhey Govinda
Sri Guru Jaya Guru Vittala Govinda
Meaning: Sing the name of Lord Sai who is our Guru, the Lord Govinda who resides in Parthi/Prashanthi Nilayam, the Lord of Radha and also known by the name of Vittala.
Songglossary: govinda, guru, jay, natha, nilaya, prashanthi, purishwara, puttaparthi, radha, sai, sri, vittala

Title: Sri Sai Rama Harey Sri
Lyrics:
Sri Sai Rama Harey Sri Sai Rama Harey
Sri Rama Chandra Prabhu Rama Chandra
Sai (Sri) Rama Chandra Harey (3)
Meaning: Worship Sai Rama who is also the Lord Rama.
Songglossary: chand, hari, prabhu, ram, sai, sri

Title: Sri Sai Rama Sundara Naama
Lyrics:
Sri Sai Rama Sundara Naama
Pavana Charana Prashanthi Rama
Jagadashraya Bhava Bandha Vimochana
Ahalyodharaka Rama Harey
Rama Harey Rama Harey
Parthi Pureesha Mangala Dhama
Pavana Charana Prashanthi Rama
